conversation.content: [bitter] They told me it was good news. [pause] "Congratulations on your promotion," haben sie gesagt, als hätte ich was gewonnen. [sarcastic] Yeah, supervisor—was ich mir schon immer gewünscht hab, ne? [sigh] Except the first thing they want me to do is... ist die Hälfte von der Schicht zu feuern. [very quietly] Meine Leute. Die Typen, die mir alles beigebracht haben. [warm] Remember when Carlos stayed three hours after his shift, nur um mir zu zeigen, wie man Paletten richtig stapelt, damit sie nicht umkippen? [sad] Or when Maria covered for me that time, als ich die ganze Versandbestellung verkackt hatte? [shaky voice] These people made me who I am. [angry] Und jetzt will die Geschäftsführung, dass ich morgen da reinmarschiere und ihnen sage, sie wären überflüssig? [frustrated] "Budget cuts," they say. "Efficiency measures." [mocking] Als ob das nicht echte Menschen mit Familien und Hypotheken wären. [pause] I keep thinking about, ähm... darüber, wie stolz Carlos ausgesehen hat, als er von meiner Beförderung gehört hat. [crying while speaking] He actually said he was proud of me. Der hat wirklich gesagt, er wär stolz auf mich. [bitter] And tomorrow I have to hand him a pink slip. Morgen muss ich ihm die Kündigung geben. [regretful] Maybe I should've just stayed a packer. Vielleicht hätt ich einfach Packer bleiben sollen. [very quietly] At least then I could look them in the eye. Wenigstens könnte ich ihnen dann noch in die Augen schauen.

original_conversation.content: [bitter] They told me it was good news. [pause] "Congratulations on your promotion," they said, like I'd won something. [sarcastic] Yeah, supervisor—what I always wanted, right? [sigh] Except the first thing they want me to do is... is let go of half the floor crew. [very quietly] My crew. The guys who taught me everything. [warm] Remember when Carlos stayed three hours after his shift to show me how to properly stack pallets so they wouldn't tip? [sad] Or when Maria covered for me that time I messed up the whole shipping order? [shaky voice] These people made me who I am. [angry] And now corporate wants me to walk in there tomorrow and tell them they're redundant? [frustrated] "Budget cuts," they say. "Efficiency measures." [mocking] Like these aren't real people with families and mortgages. [pause] I keep thinking about, um... about how proud Carlos looked when he heard about my promotion. [crying while speaking] He actually said he was proud of me. [bitter] And tomorrow I have to hand him a pink slip. [regretful] Maybe I should've just stayed a packer. [very quietly] At least then I could look them in the eye.

subject: Getting promoted from packer to supervisor but having to lay off the crew that trained you
